name: Sausage and Cheddar Frittata
description: A hearty baked egg dish with breakfast sausage, onion, tomatoes, and sharp white Cheddar—great warm or at room temperature.

ingredients.name: sharp white Cheddar, freshly grated (about 8 ounces)

steps.description: In a large cast-iron skillet over high heat, cook the breakfast sausage, breaking it up, until browned and beginning to crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon to a plate, leaving the fat in the pan.
Add the olive oil and onion to the skillet, reduce heat to medium, and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and translucent at the edges, about 5 minutes. Turn off the heat.
In a large bowl whisk the eggs, then whisk in the heavy cream. Stir in half the cooked sausage and half the Cheddar. Season with the salt and pepper.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet over the onions. Sprinkle the remaining sausage over the top, scatter the diced tomatoes, and top with the remaining Cheddar.
Set the pan over medium heat and cook just until small bubbles form around the edge, 2–3 minutes. Transfer to the oven and bake until fully set and golden, about 25 minutes.
Let cool for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley, cut into wedges, and serve warm or at room temperature with hot sauce if desired.
